title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Govt reforms, manufacturing push lift Q2 growth to 8.2%
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- 8.2% GDP growth in Q2, fueled by *reforms* to boost **manufacturing** and ease of doing business.
- **Manufacturing output** rose **9.1%** and exports grew despite global uncertainties, underscoring reform impact.
- India remains the world's fastest-growing major economy, aided by GST cuts and festive-season demand.

items.title: Defence startups need orders, not gov VC funds
items.summary:
- Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh said that funding for defence startups depends on an *order book*, with assured orders and speedy *procurement* attracting private investment, not a government‑backed VC fund.
- He added that a sovereign VC fund might be supplementary; more important are *orders*, quick contract signings, and domestic procurement to lure capital into defence manufacturing.
- Citing targets of ₹3 lakh crore in defence manufacturing and ₹50,000 crore in exports, he urged using existing budget, accelerating contracting, and identifying capable Indian firms.

items.title: Senvion India expands wind turbine manufacturing capacity, eyes global exports
Indian firms like L&T, ITC step up green goals with bigger renewable, recycling, and net-zero commitments
India in talks with 50 nations for trade pacts
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India is in talks with about 50 countries for trade pacts across 14 groups, said *Piyush Goyal*.
- A **Canada CEPA** is on the table with talks set to start next week, and GCC partners are keen to engage.
- India already has FTAs with **Australia, UAE, UK and EFTA**, and is reviewing others while pursuing deals with the US, NZ, Korea and ASEAN.

items.title: Tega to acquire Molycop; ₹1,713-crore fundraise
items.summary:
- Tega Industries signs a definitive agreement with funds managed by **American Industrial Partners** to acquire **Molycop**, in partnership with **Apollo Global Management**.
- It completes a **₹1,713-crore** preferential equity fundraise at an enterprise value of about **$1.45 billion**.
- Post‑acquisition, **Tega** will operate **26 manufacturing facilities** worldwide, expanding its global reach toward a leading, **innovation‑driven** mining solutions group.

items.title: Adani Group plans to raise ₹90,000 crore via debt in FY27
items.summary:
- The group plans to raise about **₹90,000 crore** in debt for *FY27* as part of a ₹1.57 lakh crore capex, with ~55% from domestic banks/DCM and ~45% from global sources (intl banks ~25%; global DCM ~18–20%).
- Financing supports **airports**, **energy transitions**, **ports**, **data centres** and **industrial infra** to sustain growth across markets.
- Quarterly target **₹40,000 crore**; year so far **₹80,000 crore**, with **₹44,000 crore** more expected; plan uses both debt and equity.

items.title: ₹9,000 crore defence deals with US in Nov: For maintenance of MH 60R helicopters, supply of Excalibur & Javelin
Why is India considering nuclear privatisation? PM Modi’s big shift explained
Airbus issues major A320 recall, threatening global flight disruption
India seals ₹7,995 crore MH-60R fleet support deal
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- **₹7,995 crore** sustainment package signed under the US *Foreign Military Sales* for five years for the Indian Navy's MH-60R fleet.
- The package includes spares, training, maintenance, and in-country facilities, boosting self-reliance under *Aatmanirbhar Bharat* and MSMEs.
- The LOAs under the US FMS program enhance operational availability and anti-submarine capability, with the first three MH-60Rs delivered in 2021.

items.title: India seals ₹7,995 crore MH-60R fleet support deal
items.summary:
- India signs LOAs under **Foreign Military Sales** for sustainment of 24 **MH-60R Seahawk** helicopters for five years at about ₹7,995 crore. 
- The package includes provisioning of spares, training, maintenance, and setting up in-country repair facilities, advancing **Aatmanirbhar Bharat** and MSMEs. 
- The deal enhances operational availability and enables ship/ dispersed-location operations; the first three helicopters were delivered in 2021.

items.title: ₹4,500 crore for SCL Mohali upgrade: Vaishnaw
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- Ashwini Vaishnaw announced ₹4,500 crore for upgrading SCL Mohali into a *semiconductor training centre*, a strong commercial production unit, and a world-class *R&D facility* under the *India Semiconductor Mission*. 
- The upgrade includes *process modernisation*, *new tools*, and aims to boost production by up to *100x*, supporting PM Modi's drive for a robust domestic semiconductor ecosystem. 
- MeitY is moving forward with the next phase, *Semicon 2.0*, to finalise contours of India's semiconductor programme, with SCL Mohali at the centre.

items.title: No question of privatising SCL, says Vaishnaw
Tata Electronics charges on to hire more
LG Electronics India rejigs leadership to drive post-IPO growth
India may seek 20% higher defence budget in FY26
items.summary:
- Defence Secretary *Rajesh Kumar Singh* said India will seek close to *20% higher defence allocation* in the next budget, noting the country has traditionally received a *10% higher allocation* annually.
- He pointed out that defence expenditure as a share of GDP is shrinking, leaving room to grow toward the target in FY26.
- The push comes amid *regional security concerns* and a focus on strengthening India’s *defence preparedness*.

items.title: ₹1-lakh crore R&D fund to boost private sector in India
items.summary:
- The **₹1 lakh crore** *RDI fund* will boost private R&D and open sectors like **nuclear and space**, per Jitendra Singh.
- It incentivises private players with initial hand-holding via a two-tier process led by **DST** to operationalise the corpus.
- Agencies such as **IN‑SPACe** and **BIRAC** support private-public collaboration, with ANRF established in 2023 and Modi aiming to reduce government dependence.

items.title: Aequs IPO: ₹670 crore, price ₹118–₹124
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Aequs to open a ₹670 crore IPO on 3 Dec 2025, with price band *₹118–₹124* per share.
- The issue comprises a *fresh issue up to ₹670 crore* and an OFS of up to 2,03,07,393 shares, with at least *75% of net offer reserved for QIBs*.
- Listed on *BSE and NSE*; anchor bids on *2 Dec*; minimum bid *120 shares*; refunds if *75% QIB allocation* not met.

items.title: Freudenberg expands cleanroom & battery filtration
items.summary: - **Freudenberg Filtration Technologies** launches next‑gen **FFUs**, **BIBO** systems, and **NMP**‑compatible filters for LiB and LFP battery production.\n- New **FFUs** use **HEPA**/**ULPA** filters with **ISO 14644-1** standards and deliver up to 35% lower energy use via **EC motors** for stable, quiet cleanrooms.\n- **BIBO** systems enable safe filter changes in hazardous environments, with gas-tight sealing and materials suited for **pharma**, **chemicals** and advanced battery fabs.

items.title: India-US sign ₹7,995 cr MH-60R support deal
items.summary:
- The Defence Ministry signed LOAs with the US for five-year sustainment of the Indian Navy's *MH-60R* helicopters for about **₹7,995 crore**.
- The package includes spares, support equipment, training, repairs and the establishment of *intermediate-maintenance facilities* in India.
- It advances *Aatmanirbhar Bharat*, boosts indigenous capability, reduces future US dependence, and enhances ASW-enabled fleet availability.

items.title: Avaada Group to invest ₹1 lakh crore over next 5 years; charts 'sand-to-molecule' transition
Govt Adds 18 Agencies to Coal & Lignite Prospecting List
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The government expanded the list of agencies for *coal and lignite exploration* by adding **18 private entities**, taking the total to 45.
- This is expected to save around **six months** for mining operators who previously waited for reports from **prospecting agencies**.
- The new agencies are **Accredited Prospecting Agencies** approved by the *Quality Council of India – National Accreditation Board for Education and Training*, aiming to boost private sector participation and faster exploration for energy security.

items.title: Govt to release October industrial output (IIP) data on Dec 1 amid GDP coincidence
India records six-quarter high GDP growth of 8.2% in Q2
India records six-quarter high GDP growth of 8.2% in Q2
REPM push to place India among ‘allied group of nations’, says Union Minister Kumaraswamy
Sulzer opens GBS Hub in Pune, India
items.summary: - Sulzer inaugurates a *Global Business Services Hub* in Pune, expanding its engineering footprint in India and integrating IT, Legal, Compliance and Supply Chain functions.\n- The Pune hub will support Sulzer's global operations with a capacity of *350 people*, leveraging India's talent pool, modern infrastructure and strategic location.\n- Sulzer's *191-year* engineering heritage underscores its commitment to sustainability, enabling energy efficiency and reduced carbon emissions through the expanded network.

items.title: Govt to modernise SCL Mohali with ₹4,500 cr investment: Ashwini Vaishnaw
ESDS launches Nvidia/AMD sovereign GPU service for AI
items.author: ETTelecom Desk
items.summary:
- **NVIDIA** and **AMD** powered **GPU-as-a-Service** to support **AI/ML**, *generative AI* and *LLM* development across enterprises and government sectors.
- The launch leverages **NVIDIA DGX/HGX** architectures and **AMD MI300X** platforms to train massive models, accelerate inference and manage large-scale data workloads.
- **GPU SuperPODs** feature high-bandwidth **NVLink**, unified memory pools, intelligent scheduling and AI-optimized orchestration to democratize access for enterprises and research bodies.

items.title: Waaree bags 350 MW AMPIN order
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - **Waaree Energies** secured a **350 MW** solar module supply order from **AMPIN Energy Transition** for projects across multiple locations in India.\n- The **G12R TOPCon** modules offer higher energy density, bifaciality, and improved low-light performance for utility-scale and C&I developers.\n- Deliveries are scheduled to be completed by **March 2026**, with an estimated CO₂ displacement of about *407,000 tonnes* annually.

items.title: Govt to open nuclear sector to private players: Modi
items.author: Surendra Singh
items.summary:
- PM Modi announced the government is moving to open India's nuclear sector to *private investments*, mirroring the space sector opening.
- The reforms will enable private participation in *small modular reactors*, *nuclear innovation*, boosting *energy security*.
- This comes ahead of the *Atomic Energy Bill 2025* and **CLNDA** amendments, with a target of 100 GW by 2047.

items.title: ENGIE secures 280 MW battery storage project in Gujarat, marking its first BESS contract in India
FDA flags India-made cookware for potential lead leaching
items.summary:
- The **FDA** flagged several India-made cookware as potentially leaching **lead**, following an August alert that added nine products to a discard list.
- Lead exposure can cause abdominal pain, nausea, memory loss, and other health problems, with higher risk for **women of childbearing age** and breastfeeding mothers.
- The utensils, including saucepans, brass pots, kadai, and milk pots, were sold in multiple states such as **California, Illinois, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, and DC**, with retailers urged to verify safety status.

items.title: Saini confident of Tesla setting up manufacturing plant in Haryana
India needs targeted public finance to scale green steel, avoid carbon lock-in: IEEFA
Envision Group mulls India battery plant to boost storage
items.summary:
- **Envision Group** is weighing a **5 GWh/year** India battery plant with a **$34 million** investment, localizing assembly and sourcing cells from China.
- The plan targets grid reliability as renewables grow, with India’s storage potential projected to about **46 GW by 2032** and a decision expected in **18 months**.
- There are concerns about **inexperienced bidders** in battery tenders and the need for strong techno-commercial capability to deliver projects.

items.title: Vedanta back in debt market, seeks ₹2,000 crore via metals arm
Dutch chip giant ASML eyes support office in GIFT City
items.author: Dia Rekhi, ETtech
items.summary:
- **ASML** is exploring a customer support office in *GIFT City*, Gujarat, to service its Indian customers.
- Executives reportedly visited *GIFT City* and signaled starting with a support office, with a potential expansion to a full **Dholera** facility as the fab progresses.
- The move aligns with India's push to attract *semiconductor* players and accompanies **Tata Electronics**'s planned fab in **Dholera**, expected to begin chip production by December 2026.

items.title: India needs targeted public finance to scale green steel, avoid carbon lock-in: IEEFA
Rare earths permanent magnets manufacturing to reduce imports: PM Modi
Haier seeks ₹1,000 cr capital boost; files Press Note 3 for India expansion
Budget 2026: India’s space sector seeks triple budget boost and a satellite mission for remote regions
NIRDC launches InDApp to streamline ease of doing business for MSMEs
Neuron Energy raises ₹31cr in Pre-Series B to scale batteries
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Neuron Energy raised *₹31 crore* in a *Pre-Series B* round led by Equanimity Ventures and family offices to boost EV battery tech.
- Funds will expand capacity to **3 GWh** and set up an automated production facility for *EVs* at *Chakan, Pune*, plus stronger *R&D* and international expansion.
- The company aims to reach about *₹200 crore* revenue this year and over *₹900 crore* in coming years, reinforcing leadership in *smart battery management*.

items.title: INOX Air Products inks nitrogen deal for ReNew Dholera plant
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- INOX Air Products signs a long-term deal to supply *ultra-high purity nitrogen* to ReNew Photovoltaics’ upcoming *TOPCon* solar cell facility at *Dholera*, Gujarat.
- A dedicated *air separation unit* will be installed in *Dholera* to provide continuous *UHP nitrogen* for the plant’s cell-manufacturing processes, targeting operation by the end of next year.
- This collaboration expands INOXAP’s on-site gas supply to ReNew and supports its shift from *PERC* to *TOPCon* production with a focus on purity and reliability.

items.title: Tesla India plant in Haryana: CM Nayab Singh
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - *Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini* says Tesla will set up its first India manufacturing plant in Haryana, as he inaugurates the all-in-one Tesla India Motors Centre in Gurugram.\n- He calls Haryana a *manufacturing powerhouse* and a hub for auto, IT and allied industries, expecting Tesla-related units beyond a factory.\n- The state highlights reforms like an industrial plots leasing policy, strengthened local supply chains, and a dedicated *Department of Foreign Cooperation* to attract foreign investment.

items.title: Global supply chain situation getting better: Safran CEO
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The global supply chain is improving and *we see light at the end of the tunnel*, says Safran CEO Olivier Andries.
- Ukraine war and raw-material shocks (*titanium*, *nickel*, *aluminium*) have strained supply chains, but recovery is under way.
- Safran opened its largest LEAP engine MRO in *Hyderabad* and plans an M88 MRO, with studies forecasting airlines' losses above *$11 billion* in 2025.

items.title: Dairy product manufacturer Ace International raises $35 million funding
Vedanta expands electric forklift fleet to 142 units
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Vedanta Aluminium expanded its lithium-ion powered **electric forklifts** fleet to 142 units across Odisha and Chhattisgarh, with 116 at the Jharsuguda smelter.
- The expansion is expected to cut about 4,450 tonnes of CO₂e annually and save 16.3 lakh litres of diesel, while improving safety and maintenance.
- It supports Vedanta's *net-zero by 2050* and 2030 decarbonisation goals, includes new roles for women and transgender workers, and deploys India's first **10-tonne** capacity electric forklifts.
